lead_paragraph: In an interview, Mohamed Nasheed, a former president who has received political asylum in Britain, laid out allegations against the current leader, President Abdulla Yameen.

byline.contributor: Zaheena Rasheed contributed reporting from Malé, Maldives, and Saw Nang from Mandalay, Myanmar.

headline.print_headline: Maldives President Faces Allegations of Corruption, Past and Present
headline.main: Embattled Maldives President Faces Accusations of Corruption, Past and Present

snippet: In an interview, Mohamed Nasheed, a former president who has received political asylum in Britain, laid out allegations against the current leader, President Abdulla Yameen....
abstract: Former Maldives Pres Mohamed Nasheed accuses current Pres Abdulla Yameen of corruption that dates back more than decade; contends Yameen led state-owned company that illegally sold almost $300 million in oil to Myanmar's military dictatorship in early 2000s, and says Yameen is using presidency for his own personal enrichment.
